div.span: On March 26, Riverview Administrators sent an email to families providing specific guidelines and information regarding the extension of the District’s Continuity of Education Plan. Extension of the plan will begin on Monday, March 30, 2020, and continue through the end of this crisis. A copy of this letter was also sent via the U.S. mail, and is posted on the District’s website. This plan clearly outlines specific steps and important information regarding instructional delivery, grading expectations, and more. Please make sure you read this letter in its entirety. The Riverview School District will continue to keep our students safe while creating educational opportunities that are meaningful and relevant. If you do not have the ability to view documents or instructions online, please contact your child’s principal. Thank you for your patience and cooperation during these unprecedented times. Be safe. We will work through this difficult time together!

ul.li: School closed for remainder of year April 9, 2020 *NEW*
Riverview Jr-Sr High education update March 26, 2020

li.a: How to talk to your child about COVID-19

span.strong: Follow Our Facebook Page to Stay Connected!

b.span: ATTENTION ALL RIVERVIEW JR/SR HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS:
Due to recent events surrounding the COVID-19 Pandemic, we are having to make adjustments to the 2019-2020 YEARBOOK and

Please send us photos of your time out of school using the following categories: doing schoolwork, individually practicing your spring sport, helping siblings/neighbors/etc., sending encouraging messages to local "heros", practicing social distancing with classmates (get creative).

Email school-appropriate .jpg files to Mrs. Huselton ([email protected]) with the subject "Yearbook Covid-19 photo." Please include your name, grade, category, and a brief description. You may also send pictures to any yearbook staff member and we will forward them to Mrs. Huselton for you. Let's document this time in our history together!

span.strong: We have adopted an Emergency Notification Service which allows us to send a telephone message to student homes providing important information about school events or emergencies. We are using this system to notify parents of school delays or cancellations due to inclement weather. In the event of an emergency at school, parents can have peace of mind knowing that they will be informed immediately by phone.

b.span: Unplanned School Closings, Delays, or Early Dismissals

br.span: On any given day, parents and staff are urged to use caution when making the decision to drive or walk over snow and ice covered roads.

div.span: Gladly Now We Sing Thy Praise.
We Shall Always Honor And Cherish,
Black And Gold, Thy Noble Colors
All Hail To You, Oh Riverview

strong.br: Thank you for visiting the Riverview School District website

h3.a: Music Program Hits High Note With National Award

div.div: Riverview School District does not discriminate or permit discrimination against any individual on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, parental status, marital status, age, disability, citizenship, veteran status, or genetic information in matter of employment or services or in the educational programs or activities it operates. It is the policy of the Riverview School District to comply with Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, which prohibits discrimination (including sexual harassment, sexual assault and sexual violence) based on sex in the school district's educational programs and activities. Title IX also prohibits retaliation for asserting claims of sex discrimination. The district's Title IX Coordinator, Dr. Christina Monroe, will address and respond to any inquiries concerning Title IX. Dr. Monroe can be reached at 701 Tenth Street Oakmont, PA 15139, 412.828.1800 or at [email protected]
